group1.htmlContent:
This Jigsaw component presents 2 sets of jigsaw pieces. The student needs to read / listen to the phrase that describes a picture. This should enable the student to choose the correct pieces to place into a simple jigsaw picture.

Two or more errors reveal some help options.

jigsaw1.congratulationsText: Well done! You solved the puzzle!
jigsaw1.descriptionText: Un jeune homme, portant un t-shirt rouge, passe à vélo devant un cheval dans un champ par une journée ensoleillée.
jigsaw1.descriptionTextComment: Foreign language description of picture with nouns, verbs and lots of adjectives.'
jigsaw1.instructionsText: There are two sets of puzzle pieces below. Read the description of the picture and drag the correct pieces to the table below with your mouse.

jigsaw2.instructionsText: There are two sets of puzzle pieces below. Read the description of the picture and drag the correct pieces to the table below with your mouse.
jigsaw2.descriptionText: Un beau perroquet dans une forêt luxuriante mangeant une noix du Brésil tout en regardant un jaguar au sol.
jigsaw2.COMMENTalternativeDescriptionEnglish: A beautiful parrot in a lush forest eating a Brazil nut while looking at a jaguar on the ground

jigsaw3.instructionsText: There are two sets of puzzle pieces below. Read the description of the picture and drag the correct pieces to the table below with your mouse.
jigsaw3.descriptionText: Une voiture bleue garée devant un moulin à vent.
jigsaw3.COMMENTalternativeDescriptionEnglish: A beautiful parrot in a lush forest eating a Brazil nut while looking at a jaguar on the ground

jigsaw4.instructionsText: There are two sets of puzzle pieces below. Read the description of the picture and drag the correct pieces to the table below with your mouse.
jigsaw4.descriptionText: Une voiture bleue garée devant une station de remontée mécanique au Pays de Galles par une journée brumeuse.
jigsaw4.COMMENTalternativeDescriptionEnglish: A beautiful parrot in a lush forest eating a Brazil nut while looking at a jaguar on the ground

jigsaw5.instructionsText: There are two sets of puzzle pieces below. Read the description of the picture and drag the correct pieces to the table below with your mouse.
jigsaw5.descriptionText: La scène se déroule au bord d'une rivière où les gens sont au soleil ou à l'ombre. Certains ont des parasols. Il y a des enfants et des chiens. Sur la rivière, on trouve une barque, des voiliers et deux bateaux à vapeur.
jigsaw5.descriptionTextEnglish: The scene is a river bank where people are in sun or in shade. Some have parasols. There are children and dogs. On the reiver thereis a rowing boat, some sailboats and two steamboats.

jigsaw6.instructionsText: There are two sets of puzzle pieces below. Read the description of the picture and drag the correct pieces to the table below with your mouse.
jigsaw6.descriptionText: La scène se déroule au bord d'une rivière, dans les eaux peu profondes. Trois chevaux sont attelés à une charrette à foin, en train de se rafraîchir. À gauche, une maison où une femme lave du linge. Un chien court au bord de l'eau et, sur la rive opposée, un homme pêche à côté d'une barque.
jigsaw6.descriptionTextEnglish: The scene is a river bank, in the shallows, three horses are standing, cooling, harnessed to a hay wain. On the left is a cottage where a woman is washing clothes. A dog runs along by the water and on the opposite bank a man is fishing next to a rowing boat.

wordGrid1.congratulationsText: Well done, you found them all!
wordGrid1.instructionsText: Click and drag your mouse on the grid to locate the following words:

wordGrid2.htmlContent:
This WordGrid component takes a number of words, their translations and sound files and arranges them into a word grid puzzle.

The student must know the target language version of the word and drag the mouse from the first letter to the last to highlight the word. The word is then sounded.
wordGrid2.instructionsText: Click and drag your mouse on the grid to locate the following words:

memorycards1.congratulationsText: Congratulations! You have a good memory!
memorycards1.htmlContent: This MemoryMatchGame component presents nPairsToPlay pairs of cards face dwon. The student can turn over two at a time. If either are word cards the student can play the audio of the word. If there is one word card and one picture card and they match, the audio is read out once more and the pair added to a collection of matches on the right.
memorycards1.instructionsText: Match the picture to the French word.

memorycards2.congratulationsText: Congratulations! You know your way around the house!
memorycards2.htmlContent: Another example of the MemoryMatchGame component, this time showing 12 pairs from the stock pairs.
memorycards2.instructionsText: Match the picture to the French word.

memorycards3.htmlContent: Another example of the MemoryMatchGame component, this time showing 12 pairs from the stock pairs.
memorycards3.instructionsText: Match the picture to the French word.

memorycards4.htmlContent: Another example of the MemoryMatchGame component, this time showing 26 pairs from the stock pairs. It's a bit OTT, but challenging. Suggest reducing to 20 or less for acual incorporation.
memorycards4.instructionsText: Match the picture to the French word.

memorycards5.instructionsText: Match the picture to the French word.

content:
.speak

If you add a pair of tags around part of a phrase, for example <span class(Name)='speak'></span> or <b class='speak'><b>, the system will recognise the content and turn it into a virtual anchor tag, which when clicked, will be heard by the student. Par example ici. The code will also add a title tag so that when the 'link' is hovered, contect help balloon displays 'Click to play sound'.

You can also have other braces of tags within, for example <span class='speak'>The <b>click<b> event will bubble up to the owner of the .speak class</span> e.g. Text and bold text.. Try clicking on bold and normal parts of the string. Note 'class' for html in a string, 'className' in JSX.

Unfortunately, apart from Chrome, you need to have the correct Windows language packs installed (via settings). Also, Opera doesn't handle voice recognition correctly.

readaloud1.htmlContent:
This ReadAloud component presents a phrase for the student to read out loud.

The browser listens and then uses the 'Monologue' component to compare what it thinks it hears against the target phrase and displays the differences.
readaloud1.instructionsText: Press the Record button and read the phrase please.
readaloud1.phrase: Un jeune homme, portant un t-shirt rouge, passe à vélo devant un cheval dans un champ par une journée ensoleillée.

readaloud2.htmlContent:
This ReadAloud component presents a phrase for the student to read out loud.

The browser listens and then uses the 'Monologue' component to compare what it thinks it hears against the target phrase and displays the differences.
readaloud2.instructionsText: Press the Record button and read the phrase please.
readaloud2.phrase: Bonjour, je suis anglaise et je suis mariée.

monologue1.content: Je suis marié avec Lucie. Je suis canadien et je viens de Montréal. Lucie est anglaise. Elle vient de Bristol. Elle parle anglais et un petit peu français. Je suis bilingue. Je parle anglais et français. Je suis professeur de maths et Lucie est avocate.
monologue1.instructionsText: Listen to the sound sample and type what you hear, then press the "Check" button.

phraseTable1.htmlContent: This PhraseTable component presents a simple table of phrases, translations and audio in a columnar table.
phrases: Bonjour, Madame Foucher ! Comment ça va ?
lo, Mme Foucher! How are you?
sounds/fr/Bonjour, Madame Foucher ! Comment ça va.mp3
Bonjour Monsieur Letort ! Ça va très bien. Et vous* ?
lo M Letort, I'm very well, thank you. And you?
sounds/fr/Bonjour Monsieur Letort ! Ça va très bien. Et vous.mp3
My name is Max. And you're….?

content:
1 Silent letters at the end of a word

The consonants d, g, p, s, t, x, z are silent when they are the last letter of the word. Listen to the following examples.

grand, rond, long, trop, depuis, pas, petit, salut, gâteaux, appelez

The letter e is not pronounced at the end of a word:

Je m'appelle, bibliothécaire, célibataire

NB 2-letter words ending in e are exceptions:

ce, de, je, le, me, ne, se, te

2 Th

In French the letters th are pronounced t. e.g. Thomas, thé, théologie, maths
explanation4.htmlContent:
This Explanation component is for introducing passages of explanatory text. I'm not hugely happy with it as it involves putting HTML into strings which are then injected into divs.

So if you have a more complicated piece of content, I suggest you use a CustomComponent. The following Grammar section is an example of a CustomComponent.

If there is more than one string, more than one panel is presented.

wordparts1.htmlContent:
The WordParts component, uses phrases to populate the left column of a table. The set of phrases contains square brackets to indicate where a part of a phrase matches the question set. If the student clicks on a correct part of the word or phrase, it spins and highlights in green. If incorrect, it highlights red. On the right hand side there are audio samples to assist the student if needed.

After two mistakes, a cheat option is revealled.
wordparts1.instructionsText: Listen to the following phrases. Each phrase contains at least 2 of the following:  on, oi, r, h. Can you identify them? Click on them to reveal them.

dropdowns1.htmlContent: The DropDowns component, uses phrases to populate the left column of a table. The set of phrases contains square brackets to indicate where a part of a phrase should be replaced by a 'dropdown' or 'select'. The verttical bar '|' separated phrases or words are used to populate the options of the select. The one preceded by the asterisk indicates the correct answer. If the student clicks on a correct part of the word or phrase, it spins and highlights in green. If incorrect, it highlights red. On the right hand side there are audio samples to assist the student if needed.
dropdowns1.instructionsText: Listen to the speakers and select the correct adjective of nationality.

answerTable1.htmlContent: The AnswerTable component, uses phrases to populate the left column of a table. The second of each phrase is the correct answer to the question. The user must type the correct answer into the input in the right hand column and press the 'Check'. Button. The text box is a compact Monologue component, see below.
answerTable1.instructionsText: Supply the feminine form of the adjectives and nouns listed below. If the forms are different, compare the Pronunciation Write the feminine form in the empty cells, then click the check button.

group.htmlContent: This Group component is for grouping a number of other components together. I have generally used it for grouping Exercises in the real learning objects.

wordsIntoSlots1.htmlContent:
The 'blanksType': 'table' configuration of the Blanks component, uses the words to make tiles which can be dropped into a 2 column table.

After two mistakes, help and cheat options are revealled.
wordsIntoSlots1.instructionsText: You will hear words containing on / om or oi or h as described in the pronunciation section. Drop each word into the boxes below as you hear it.

wordsIntoSlots2.htmlContent:
The 'blanksType': 'questions-answers' configuration of the Blanks component, uses the answers to make tiles which can be dropped into the second column of a 2 column table, where the questions are used to populate the left column.

Sound files are in the third column.

After two mistakes, help and cheat options are revealled.
questions: Salut les enfants ! Tout va bien ?
answers: Moi, oui, ça va … mais Jo est malade depuis hier.
Ah non ! je suis étudiante en histoire.

phrases3.htmlContent:
The 'blanksType': 'phrases' configuration of the Blanks component, uses the words to make tiles which can be dropped into the set of phrases. The set of phrases contains square brackets to show where the words must be dropped, the word is hidden in the phrase. On the right hand side there are audio samples to assist the student if needed. Note: the blank spaces are all the same width even for small words, so they don't give an extra clue!

After two mistakes, help and cheat options are revealled.
phrases3.instructionsText: Drag the words to fill in the gaps.
audio: sounds/fr/Bonjour les enfants. Comment vous appelez-vous.mp3
sounds/fr/Bonjour Madame ! Je m' appelle Annie.mp3
sounds/fr/Au revoir les enfants !  Bonne journée !.mp3

connectFour1.htmlContentXXX: Another example of the MemoryMatchGame component, this time showing 12 pairs from the stock pairs.

mockney1.instructionsText: Type text to translate to mockney

crossword1.htmlContent: The CrossWord component is very experimental and incomplete.
crossword1.instructionsText: Simply type the letters for the answers into the grid.
